citation.article-title: Rhodospira trueperi gen. nov., spec. nov., a new phototrophic Proteobacterium of the alpha group

p.s: Rhodospira (Rho.do.spi'ra. Gr.n. rhodos the rose; Gr.n. spira the spiral; M.L. fem.n. Rhodospira the rose spiral)
Individual cells are vibrioid- to spirilloid-shaped.
Multiplication by binary fission; motile by means of flagella.
Intracytoplasmic membrane system of vesicular type.
Contains bacteriochlorophyll b and carotenoids as photosynthetic pigments.
Growth occurs preferably photoorganotrophically under anoxic conditions in the light, but is also possible under microoxic conditions in the dark.
According to the 16S rDNA sequence of the type strain of its type species, the genus belongs to the alpha group of the Proteobacteria.
Type species: Rhodospira trueperi sp. nov.
